title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: A nor'easter is expected to impact the Boston area late Sunday night into Monday with heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding.
Forecasters predict southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island will face the greatest impacts, with possible power outages due to heavy, wet snow.
Snowfall of 6 inches or more is expected in parts of southeastern Massachusetts, with blizzard conditions possible on Cape Cod and the Islands.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman declined to comment on Red Sox president Sam Kennedy's remarks about his departure from the team.
Sam Kennedy suggested that Bregman could have stayed with the Red Sox if he wanted; Bregman now plays for the Cubs.
Bregman valued a no-trade clause from the Cubs, absent in Boston's offer, as a factor in his decision to leave.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now' (Redux) featuring Robert Duvall is available on Pluto TV and Plex.
'The Last Thing He Told Me' Season 2 with Jennifer Garner is streaming on Apple TV.
'Predator: Badlands' is streaming on Hulu, continuing the Predator series with a new adventure.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora states Marcelo Mayer must earn a spot on the Opening Day roster during spring training.
Mayer, 23, needs to improve offensively; he batted .228 with four home runs in 44 games last season.
Mayer has struggled with injuries since being drafted in 2021; he's aiming to secure a starting infield role.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Forecasts predict a high-impact nor'easter Sunday night into Monday, affecting southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding are likely, with potential power outages across the region.
Snowfall predictions suggest a foot or more for South Shore and Cape areas; Boston could receive similar totals.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court in-person, using a wheelchair, for the first time since allegedly killing her children in 2023.
Clancy faces charges of murder and strangulation in the deaths of her three children and is set for a July 20 trial.
Clancy's defense argues she suffered from postpartum mental illness and plans an insanity defense; a bifurcated trial is requested.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly approved a transfer fee on home sales over $1 million, aiming to generate $60 million annually.
The transfer fee proposal, allowing fees from 0.5% to 4%, advances to the Massachusetts state legislature for approval.
Local governments would receive 90% of revenue to fund housing initiatives, while 10% supports a year-round housing trust.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police prepared for a 'Northshore Mall takeover' scheduled for Friday at 3 p.m. to ensure public safety.
Events like the 'takeover' have involved large crowds, vehicle stunts, and blocked streets, raising safety concerns.
Gov. Maura Healey announced a $14 million safety grant for prevention; proposed legislation targets reckless vehicle use.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven members of the Harvard Street Gang face federal drug and firearms charges after a coordinated investigation.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, multiple kilograms of drugs, and over $40,000 in cash across Eastern Massachusetts.
Defendants include Brockton's Lue Andrade and Randolph's London Cohen, linked to drug trafficking and firearm offenses.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Celtics for the Warriors, citing reasons deeper than just basketball.
The Celtics aimed to reduce salary under the luxury tax, influencing Horford's decision.
Horford spent seven seasons with the Celtics, winning his only NBA title with the team.
